items.content_text:
While I’ve come within proximity of the issue many times in my career, I’ve survived long enough only shallowly understanding line endings.

I can live in ignorance no more! Time to dive in:

https://www.aleksandrhovhannisyan.com/blog/crlf-vs-lf-normalizing-line-endings-in-git/

“If you leave a Mastodon server, you can take both your followers and the people you follow with you.” - https://pluralistic.net/2022/12/19/better-failure/#let-my-tweeters-go

Yes, but what about taking your content with you too?
“Plain-text format can be parsed or deserialized ‘by eye’” YES! https://wiki.c2.com/?PowerOfPlainText

re: /#20221017111256
I did something like this for the https://tech.sagesure.com website when I built it. ASCII art generators are fun!
https://cdn.jim-nielsen.com/microblog/2022-12-20T14-58-24Z.png

Still love when web teams put little easter eggs in the devtools, like this logo for @medium.com in the console
https://cdn.jim-nielsen.com/microblog/2022-12-20T14-57-36Z.png
